Ask HN: When will LCH color space be available in browsers other than Safari
text: Perhaps somebody who works on Chrome or Firefox is reading here, I was just wondering if there is an estimate for when the LCH color space will be available in browsers other than Safari? I could swear it has been touted as arriving 'this year' for the last two years. For reference for anyone not knowing what this is article by Lea Verou https://lea.verou.me/2020/04/lch-colors-in-css-what-why-and-how/ The article points to bugs in both browsers bugtrackers - FF is not clear as to progress, last post was 6 months ago, google last post says : "If Chromium were to prioritize this most of us web developers could use it by 2024. Otherwise it won’t be usable by most until at least 2026."  Which is disheartening to read, but does 'most of us could use it' mean that people could actually start using it in 2023 (giving up 2022 at this point)

title: Werner Heisenberg and His Terrible PhD Defense
Ask HN: How to migrate out of Gmail and Google Suite?
text:
I am terrified by the stories of people getting lock out of their accounts. I want my family to use email addresses and data, which we truly own. It is just too important to depend on a faceless corporation and their bots.

Could you help me finding the right solutions without spending too much (<1000 USD / year, family of four)?

The ideal lists of the solutions I need, and the alternatives I've seen:

- Email (custom domains)

- Calendar

- Storage

- Photos

- Docs (?)

- VPN would be nice too

I could potentially self-host, but I'm afraid I will make upgrades to rarely and will have more security vulnerabilities that a paid, hosted system.

Fastmail looks interesting for the email part. Proton checks several boxes, but with no family plan, it's very expensive (and doesn't cover Photos or Docs).
